intro: Agoseris agrestis, commonly known as the rough agoseris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive white center. Agoseris agrestis is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
